definition: Narnia, children's fantasy world in stories by C.S. Lewis
to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing
Buddhist nun/(often used in phonetic spellings)
The Chronicles of Narnia, children's stories by C.S. Lewis

sentences.english: But while that Tree flourishes she will never come down into Narnia.
sentences.chinese: 但只要这棵树枝繁叶茂，她就决不敢进入纳尼亚。

sentences.english: Edmund and Lucy return to Narnia with their spoilt cousin Eustace Scrubb.
sentences.chinese: 艾文和鲁思与他们被宠坏了的表弟尤斯特回到纳尼亚。

sentences.english: And we don't even know if tails are worn long in Narnia.
sentences.chinese: 而我们甚至并不知道，在纳尼亚马儿是否留长尾巴呢。

sentences.english: An hour's life there is better than a thousand years in Calormen.
sentences.chinese: 纳尼亚生活一小时胜过在卡乐门生活一千年。

sentences.english: Narnia must go to the aid of King Lune.
sentences.chinese: 纳尼亚必须去支援国王伦恩。

sentences.english: But I have to think of hundreds of years in the life of Narnia.
sentences.chinese: 但我必须为纳尼亚的生存作数百年的长远打算。
